reviews.review_msg: mid terms are so hard, shes asking questions that I have never seen on the textbook although its only mcq but the choices are so confusing af, she only use a few slides of ppt as her lecture and I dont think that helps yall have to spend some time and read the book  . I DONT  REALLY RECOMMEND TAKING THIS COURSE !! 3/10
Boring lectures and too much work

The textbook is huge for one. The tests come from the textbooks and discussions in class, have to write at least 4 personal reflections and the group projects are enlightening. 
Natasha is nice and a great instructor nonetheless.
Talks fast. Lectures are short but most test questions come from textbook. Easy class as mostly personal reflections.
She's very caring and understanding. I had lots of trouble with covid and she was the best.

She was very sweet and super helpful, but she often went on on her own. She doesn't focus much on the textbook, however the final exams are based solely on textbook knowledge and applying it. Advice: For the group presentation, ensure that you use a lot of videos or clips to show your effort.
Will take another psyc course with her next term. Good teacher.

Natasha is a nice person, but her course is not the easiest. we had 4 tests for every 2 chapter, it consisted of 90 MCQ questions. The whole class's average every time was only 40%-50%. Level of her tests did not match to her lectures. There are lots of reading, memorizing. I would not recommend taking this course with her.

Powerpoints are irrelevant to the textbook. She teaches us extra things which is not included on the textbook orally while not putting it down in detail on her notes. Should we suppose to google it? Tests are relatively having high proportion of marks for those extra things.

extremely terrible and stressful course. Expects you to read the textbook with lots of info. Tests and exams are really tough with very low average. I used to want to have psyc as my major but after this course, I just gave up.
She only teaches us briefly in each chapters. We need to read 70% of the textbook ourselves to do the test. Not very good at teaching.
Boring lectures. Speak so fast. The lectures are not well-organised. Need to read the textbook which she would not covered in detail during the lesson by yourself in order to do the tests.
In the class she just repeats the lecture note, and she never replies my email :)))) I gonna retake PSYC102 next semester lol

She is a good instructor who has great insight towards course material and very caring. There is a group presentation. Exams are all multiple choice questions. It's better to read your textbook carefully as there are many questions from textbook only. You need to know your textbook well.  If you make enough effort, you will get a great mark.
Natasha is great, very nice and helpful. I like her lectures it is pretty interesting, but she talks a bit fast so it's hard to keep up when taking notes. Other than that she is super nice.
Natasha was funny and use examples to help. Classes too long! 4hours!
Very fast. In fact, the fastest teacher when it comes to talking. Don't bother taking smart notes cos you'll get confused most times.

If you are FIC students, you might have chance to take her ILS and that is your opportunity! ILS is required course for you and her ILS is always fun, but still focused on ILS academic materials. You better be fast to get her class.
Lots of work as a course, but she kept lectures interesting and engaging. Very approachable, and always willing to help. Great prof, I highly recommend her!
TAs were super helpful, but the prof was not engaged with the students at all. Hard marker and often difficult to get in contact with.
Prof herself was not very useful and I felt that it was hard to contact her at times; the TAs were usually the ones you talk to and ask questions to. Easy course if you're into writing and reading.
I take class at FIC. Good professor. always give examples to help class.

Was pregnant, so she only taught the lecture portion. Candace was a great TA and she gave a lot of feedback on the writing assignments. Tests were average in difficulty and requires knowledge and examples from both lecture and course material.
The class itself is not hard, but she is a really hard marker. She also changes her mind really fast. If she says one thing, it WILL change the next time you ask her.

This professor was relatively good at explaining the information in this course. However her attitude needs work. She gives students sarcastic and negative feedback/comments. Uncaring would be a good description.

Great prof very nice and knew her stuff, little trouble between TA and prof. communication. wouldnt recommend this class if you dont like writing or lots of work  but the lectures are engaging and intersting course material
Yeah, I agree. Alot of work but lots of feedback on my assignments.
This class is alot of work but you get alot of feedback on your writing.
Absolutely fantastic!

If you read the textbook and go to your labs you can get a good mark in this class no problem. The midterm and final were a breeze. Lectures are a waste of time because she practically reads from the textbook. Labs were harder, but you basically just have to go and you'll be fine.
I don't know what everybody's talking about, Natasha was awesome.  She sets you up to succeed, and if you bother to do the work, you'll do well.

Uhhh...no, run the other way. Lectures straight out the textbook. Nothing interesting or particularly useful. If you read the textbook, you don't even have to go to her lectures. You'll just get bored anyway... Her TAs were...well, they were unjustifiably harsh and sticklers for detail.
Her TA's suck, they are nit picky, snobby, and hard markers. Bad combo!
I totally agree with the last person's rating. Natasha is alright But the T.A's are horrible.
Although Natasha lectures right out of the text book, I thought her exams were fair. I think it was the TA's who were hard markers, not the prof.
This prof is no good! One of the worst teachers I have had in my 3 years in University. The fact that she is nice does not change the fact that she should NOT BE TEACHING... aviod her at all costs!!
Awesome prof! Totally helpful and always had time for questions.

Dr Ghosh made research methods fun. I liked that she used the text as it was easier to understand when I actually read it. She's really helpful and totally approachable. I agree, she should teach 300 level courses!

Yes, she copies straight out of the text book but lots of professors do that. Final exam was difficult. I enjoyed the class and thought she was very helpful when you approach her for help. I wish she taught 300 level Psych courses because I enjoyed being in her class.

she is copying the material from the book, useless to go to class, especially she talks fast and u cant write anything down. hardmarker, oh my god, average for one the assignment was 6 something out of 10. Is she retaliating or what?
Worst instructor I have had. she is not interested in the material she coveres, only follows exactly what's on the book, and the final exam was not fair at all.

She rushes.  DO not expect to learn much in lecture.  her slides are the textbook word for word.  If you study the text during the time u are scheduled for the lecture, you would learn more. She seems really nice and cheerful, but that doesnt help students learn the cirriculum.

Sarcastic and stubborn, difficult to approach. Repeats the textbook word-for-word in lecture, however she is fairly cheerful and you know exactly what to expect. Puts all slides online and checks WebCT regularly
By far one of the BEST Psych professors SFU has. I highly recommand her!!

By far one of the best professors I had. She is very friendly and encourages questions in class. She is also very approachable for help. Her final exam was hard and the wording for some of the questions was confusing. However, I still enjoyed the class and hope that she teaches some third year courses next semester. I HIGHLY recommand her!
unorganized, stubborn, self-concious, high self-esteem, but tries to act very helpful and friendly

definetly take this course with alder. she's highly disorganized with her lectures and ALWAYS posts grades up really late so that they render almost useless to help you for your next exam. she's also a tough prof too. on one of our exam questions, 38/39 people immediately lost 50% because she wasnt clear on what she expected
she's hard and disorganized. take the course with alder, he's so much better and more interesting. classes are actually fun to go to. his exams are fair too unlike hers.
Approachable and friendly. Knows her stuff and is enthusiatic about teaching. Exams were hard but fair.
Very approachable and friendly;however,very disorganized when posting grades as well as posting lecture slides.

it can be a dry course. she didnt make it easy, that's for sure. essay questions are tough, as usual 50% is about the average for the essay questions on exams. papers were a bit harder than psyc 100. the final actually has an essay question!!! unheard of apparently
don't take it with her

makes a 2 hour lecture feel like 1 hour. really friendly and seemingly easygoing. relates all material to examples to ease understanding. not well-prepared for interession. extremely disorganized. posts marks up too late, and does not respond to email. not clear with exam questions. overall, if organization was improved, would be very good prof.

Great prof! Lecture notes usually put up the day before, would be better if put up sooner. Very helpful, willing to answer all questions. Fair marker, I don't know what the other guy was saying - we haven't had anything marked before this weeK!
not very organized! Lectures were always posted AFTER thelectures were given. what's the point?!? Notes were vague and unclear.

not very friendly, very rude and criticizes people when they're trying to make their points. always finds faults instead of encouraging to speak out. She also favors some people over others. Not a fair maker either.
Made a difficult course easy to understand and easy to approach for help. Great textbook too! The person to watch out for is the TA who wasn't very friendly or easy to approach for help.
super easy....she's so cool too...if you need to take psyc 201...take it with her....you'll get at least a B if you tried
very nice! she made the course easy to understand, and was very helpful throughout the whole course. really great teacher.
Awesome, especially for her first semester here!!  The final was very hard but the mid-term was easy so it all equaled out.  Highly recommended.
